header.note: We are in the process of moving strings from Bloom.xlf to BloomMediumPriority.xlf and BloomLowPriority.xlf while trying very hard to preserve translations and approval status.

trans-unit.source: eSpeak failed.
trans-unit.note: This text is shown if an error occurred while running eSpeak. eSpeak is a piece of software that this program uses to do text-to-speech (have the computer read text out loud).

trans-unit.source: Please split or clear the existing recording in this text box before changing modes.
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool, enable "Record the whole text box...", make a recording, and then attempt to uncheck the "Record the whole text box..." input (without first clearing the audio recordings you are about to lose)
For "split", please use same terminology as in ID: EditTab.Toolbox.TalkingBookTool.SplitLabel
For "clear", please use same terminology as in ID: EditTab.Toolbox.TalkingBookTool.Clear

trans-unit.source: Sorry, front and back-matter pages must be recorded by sentences.
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then attempt to toggle the "Record by Sentences" input on an XMatter page

trans-unit.source: Import Recording...
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: Replace with new audio?
If you import this recording, it will replace all the audio for this text box.
Insert Segment Marker
trans-unit.note: A segment marker is just "|" and it is used to break a sentence up into smaller sections for highlighting in sync with the audio.
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: Apply Timings File...
trans-unit.note: A timings file is either from Audacity or generated by Bloom. It contains one line for each segment of the text. The line contains the start and stop time of the audio that should be synchronized with that text segment.
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: Edit Timings File...
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: Press this to insert a "|" character into the text at the current cursor position. This character tells Bloom to introduce a new segment for the purpose of highlighting the text during audio playback. You can also just type the "|" character using your keyboard.
First, put the cursor in a box which has something to record.
trans-unit.note: This is shown on a button that only makes sense if the cursor is in a box of text.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change this mode, first use the "Clear" button to remove your recording.
Record one sentence at a time. You can break up sentences using the `|` character.
Record the whole text box in one take, or load in a recording.
Import an mp3 recording of the whole text box.
This is disabled because this box is not in `Record by Text Box` mode.
Open the timing file in a text editor. After you save your changes, click the "Apply Timings File" button.
This is only enabled after doing a "Split" of a recording of the whole text box.

This lets you choose a file containing timings for aligning the audio with the text. The format of the file is tab-separated values, with the first column being the start time in seconds, and the second column being the end time in seconds. The third column is often a label, but it will be ignored.
Control the order in which various boxes on the page are played back.
By Sentence
By Whole Textbox
Show playback order buttons
trans-unit.note: Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: Show image descriptions
trans-unit.note: Image descriptions are typed out, then recorded, so that the book can be used by the blind. This is a switch that shows the typed out image descriptions next to each image on the page.
Shown if you open TalkingBookTool and then open the 'Advanced' subsection

trans-unit.source: drag
trans-unit.note: Used in the Key hints at the bottom of the Overlay Tool for Alt+drag and Ctrl+drag.

trans-unit.source: resize
trans-unit.note: Used in the Key hint at the bottom of the Overlay Tool for "Alt + drag = resize".

trans-unit.source: move
trans-unit.note: Used in the Key hint at the bottom of the Overlay Tool for "Ctrl + drag = move".

trans-unit.source: Special Sentence-Ending Punctuation
Select this if you want readers to be able to choose to read the book in this language.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether this language will be included in the published book.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this language is currently shown in the book, so it is required.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether this language will be included in the published book. In this case, the user is not allowed to change the value.

trans-unit.source: Select this if you want to include this audio.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether the Talking Book audio for this language will be included in the published book.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this book does not have any audio in this language.
trans-unit.note: This is a tooltip on a checkbox. The checkbox contains the name of a language. The checkbox controls whether the Talking Book audio for this language will be included in the published book. In this case, the user is not allowed to change the value.

trans-unit.source: This book does not have any interactive activities.
This book has interactive activities.
This is disabled because publishing interactive activities is a Bloom Enterprise feature.
This is disabled because this book does not have any overlay elements that qualify as “comic-like”, such as speech bubbles.
Select this if you want to list this book as a Comic Book. This only affects how the book is categorized, it does not affect the content of the book.
This is disabled because this book does not have any pages with motion enabled.
Select this if you want to show motion when the book is read in landscape mode.
This is disabled because this book does not have any videos.
The videos in this book contain {N}
trans-unit.note: {N} will be replaced with a link whose text is the name of the (sign) language and which opens a chooser

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this collection has {no sign language selected}.
trans-unit.note: The result should have a section in braces. This will become a hot link which will open a user interface that lets the user select a sign language.

trans-unit.source: This is disabled because this book does not have any Talking Book recordings.
This is disabled because no “Talking Book Languages” are selected.
This is disabled because this book does not have any image descriptions in the primary language.
Select this if you want to list this book as accessible to the visually impaired in the primary language. This only affects how the book is categorized, it does not affect the content of the book.
Show this book only to reviewers with whom I share the URL of this book.
Visibility
Show this book only to reviewers with whom I share the URL of this book.
Visibility
Consider whether you can distribute your book using the BloomPUB format instead of, or in addition to, the ePUB format.
[Some Bloom features] are not supported by most or all ePUB readers.
trans-unit.note: The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.

trans-unit.source: Notes:
About ePUB Readers & Bloom
Most ePUB readers are very low quality ([see our research and recommendations]).
trans-unit.note: The text inside the [square brackets] will become a link to a website.

trans-unit.source: Not available on Linux
trans-unit.note: "Linux" is an operating system name which may not translate.

trans-unit.source: This feature is available only on the Windows version of Bloom. We apologize for the inconvenience.
trans-unit.note: "Windows" and "Linux" are operating system names which may not translate.
